= Twitter Feed Juice Extension =

[ExtensionList Extension] to embed the results of a search of Twitter in to a page.

Author: *Richard Wallis*<br/>
Juice Version: > 0.4.3

== Operation ==

Based upon options passed, displays a list of tweets in the page. The results are not refreshed over time, so a page refresh is required for new tweets to appear.  Options for the control are passed on to it.  The style of the display is controlled by a default `TwitterFeed.css`. This can be overridden by passing in your own css file. 

== Example code ==
{{{
var html = '<div id="hpContainer" style="width: 100%; margin-right: auto; margin-left: auto; text-align: left; height: auto;"/>';
var insert = new JuiceInsert(html,"#pageContent","append");
insert.show();

$jq('#hpContainer').append("Library Tweets");
var ops = {
	height : "280px",
	width : "350px",
	showAvatar : true,
	showId : true,
	showLink : true,
	count: 4
};
new TwitterFeedJuice(juice,insert,"hpCenterBody","#talis",ops);
}}}

== Prerequisites ==
=== Loaded modules ==
{{{
juice.loadJs("http://{MyServer}/extensions/TwitterFeed.js");
juice.loadCss("http://{MyServer}/extensions/TwitterFeed.css");
}}}

=== Data requirements ===
None

== Constructor arguments ==
{{{GoogleRSSFeedJuice(ju,insert,targetDiv,query,opts,css)}}}

  * ju - instance of juice
  * insert - JuiceInsert for page
  * targetDiv - id of element within insert to contain control
  * query - query to send to Twitter (eg. 'From:rjw' or '#talis')
  * opts - controlling options 
  * css - URL of css file to override default css setting - optional
